Name: datdba
Description: owner of the database, usually the user who created it

Name: encoding
Description: character encoding for this database (pg_encoding_to_char() can translate this number to the encoding name)

Name: datlocprovider
Description: locale provider for this database: c = libc, i = icu

Name: datistemplate
Description: if true, then this database can be cloned by any user with createdb privileges; if false, then only superusers or the owner of the database can clone it.

Name: datallowconn
Description: if false then no one can connect to this database. this is used to protect the template0 database from being altered.

Name: datconnlimit
Description: sets maximum number of concurrent connections that can be made to this database. -1 means no limit, -2 indicates the database is invalid.

Name: datfrozenxid
Description: all transaction ids before this one have been replaced with a permanent ("frozen") transaction id in this database. this is used to track whether the database needs to be vacuumed in order to prevent transaction id wraparound or to allow pg_xact to be shrunk. it is the minimum of the per-table pg_class.relfrozenxid values.

Name: datminmxid
Description: all multixact ids before this one have been replaced with a transaction id in this database. this is used to track whether the database needs to be vacuumed in order to prevent multixact id wraparound or to allow pg_multixact to be shrunk. it is the minimum of the per-table pg_class.relminmxid values.

Name: dattablespace
Description: the default tablespace for the database. within this database, all tables for which pg_class.reltablespace is zero will be stored in this tablespace; in particular, all the non-shared system catalogs will be there.

Name: daticulocale
Description: icu locale id for this database

Name: datcollversion
Description: provider-specific version of the collation. this is recorded when the database is created and then checked when it is used, to detect changes in the collation definition that could lead to data corruption.
